column4: Hi. I just attempted to upgrade to 8.10. It appeared to succeed. But now whenever I boot it up, my splash screen is gone, and it gives me some error about my /home partition, "can't find fsck.ext3", and drops me to a root shell prompt. If i exit the prompt, it resumes boot, but I don't login. I don't want to login if something's wrong with my /home. I'm in my custom Hardy LiveDVD right now, and my home partition appears to be fine. What shoul
d I do to make my 8.10 realize that?
can you mount your / partition? and cat the file /etc/fstab
I can mount / just fine. Should I cat /etc/fstab and pastebin it, or...?
I actually had the exact same problem after my upgrade. but I didn't look into the problem more deeply.  I should have lol might still be able to help though
Okay. Forgot to install pastebinit on my liveDVD, so...
well you can just go to pastebin online is fine.
You're having the same problem too? With a /home partition? I mean... can you actually still use it? Anyways, pastebin here: http://pastebin.com/f19e541bf
well I was having the same problem. but rather than troubleshoot it I just did a clean install. one sec
Oh, I see. I'll do that if I can't fix it then. I was considering a switch to 64-bit ubuntu anyways...
if you run gparted and look at the partitons is the /dev/hda7 your /home?
I remember specifically that gparted messed up the order of my partition table, but it didn't really seem to hurt anything.
So in case you missed it 'cos I didn't blink you, yes, /dev/hda7 is my /home. :)
well yes. but I want to verify that /dev/hda7 still = /home.  IE it could be that after the upgrade for some reason the /dev/hda7 changed to /dev/hdaX and now ubuntu can't find the /home
I see. Well, that part's still good.
run df and pastebin it
http://pastebin.com/f769270dc I don't think it will be much help. Again, I'm currently in my custom LiveDVD.
okay. so if you go to /media/disk-1 and do an ls this is your home stuff correct?
I don't need to ls. I can just open it in nautilus. :P I'm absolutely positive it's my home.
okay well that works as well.  well that's my only idea really. cause it does seem to be mapped correctly. doh!
Well darn. Thanks for trying, though. :D
sure sorry I couldn't help more!
